trans-unit.source: How to use table storage from PHP | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How to use table storage from PHP | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use the Table service from PHP to create and delete a table, and insert, delete, and query the table.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use the Table service from PHP to create and delete a table, and insert, delete, and query the table.

trans-unit.source: This guide shows you how to perform common scenarios using the Azure Table service.
trans-unit.target: This guide shows you how to perform common scenarios using the Azure Table service.

trans-unit.source: The samples are written in PHP and use the <linkText>Azure SDK for PHP[download]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: The samples are written in PHP and use the <linkText>Azure SDK for PHP[download]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The scenarios covered include creating and deleting a table, and inserting, deleting, and querying entities in a table.
trans-unit.target: The scenarios covered include creating and deleting a table, and inserting, deleting, and querying entities in a table.

trans-unit.source: For more information on the Azure Table service, see the <linkText>Next steps</linkText><title></title> section.
trans-unit.target: For more information on the Azure Table service, see the <linkText>Next steps</linkText><title></title> section.

trans-unit.source: The only requirement for creating a PHP application that accesses the Azure Table service is the referencing of classes in the Azure SDK for PHP from within your code.
trans-unit.target: The only requirement for creating a PHP application that accesses the Azure Table service is the referencing of classes in the Azure SDK for PHP from within your code.

trans-unit.source: You can use any development tools to create your application, including Notepad.
trans-unit.target: You can use any development tools to create your application, including Notepad.

trans-unit.source: In this guide, you use Table service features which can be called from within a PHP application locally, or in code running within an Azure web role, worker role, or website.
trans-unit.target: In this guide, you use Table service features which can be called from within a PHP application locally, or in code running within an Azure web role, worker role, or website.

trans-unit.source: To use the Azure Table service APIs, you need to:
trans-unit.target: To use the Azure Table service APIs, you need to:

trans-unit.source: Reference the autoloader file using the <linkText>require_once[require_once]</linkText><title></title> statement, and
trans-unit.target: Reference the autoloader file using the <linkText>require_once[require_once]</linkText><title></title> statement, and

trans-unit.source: Reference any classes you might use.
trans-unit.target: Reference any classes you might use.

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to include the autoloader file and reference the ServicesBuilder class.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows how to include the autoloader file and reference the ServicesBuilder class.

trans-unit.source: This example (and other examples in this article) assume you have installed the PHP Client Libraries for Azure via Composer.
trans-unit.target: This example (and other examples in this article) assume you have installed the PHP Client Libraries for Azure via Composer.

trans-unit.source: If you installed the libraries manually or as a PEAR package, you need to reference the WindowsAzure.php autoloader file.
trans-unit.target: If you installed the libraries manually or as a PEAR package, you need to reference the WindowsAzure.php autoloader file.

trans-unit.source: In the examples below, the require_once statement is always shown, but only the classes necessary for the example to execute are referenced.
trans-unit.target: In the examples below, the require_once statement is always shown, but only the classes necessary for the example to execute are referenced.

trans-unit.source: To instantiate an Azure Table service client, you must first have a valid connection string.
trans-unit.target: To instantiate an Azure Table service client, you must first have a valid connection string.

trans-unit.source: The format for the Table service connection string is:
trans-unit.target: The format for the Table service connection string is:

trans-unit.source: For accessing a live service:
trans-unit.target: For accessing a live service:

trans-unit.source: For accessing the emulator storage:
trans-unit.target: For accessing the emulator storage:

trans-unit.source: To create any Azure service client, you need to use the ServicesBuilder class.
trans-unit.target: To create any Azure service client, you need to use the ServicesBuilder class.

trans-unit.source: You can:
trans-unit.target: You can:

trans-unit.source: pass the connection string directly to it or
trans-unit.target: pass the connection string directly to it or

trans-unit.source: use the CloudConfigurationManager (CCM) to check multiple external sources for the connection string:
trans-unit.target: use the CloudConfigurationManager (CCM) to check multiple external sources for the connection string:

trans-unit.source: by default, it comes with support for one external source - environmental variables
trans-unit.target: by default, it comes with support for one external source - environmental variables

trans-unit.source: you can add new sources by extending the ConnectionStringSource class
trans-unit.target: you can add new sources by extending the ConnectionStringSource class

trans-unit.source: For the examples outlined here, the connection string will be passed directly.
trans-unit.target: For the examples outlined here, the connection string will be passed directly.

trans-unit.source: A TableRestProxy object lets you create a table with the createTable method.
trans-unit.target: A TableRestProxy object lets you create a table with the createTable method.

trans-unit.source: When creating a table, you can set the Table service timeout.
trans-unit.target: When creating a table, you can set the Table service timeout.

trans-unit.source: (For more information about the Table service timeout, see <linkText>Setting timeouts for Table service operations[table-service-timeouts]</linkText><title></title>.)
trans-unit.target: (For more information about the Table service timeout, see <linkText>Setting timeouts for Table service operations[table-service-timeouts]</linkText><title></title>.)

trans-unit.source: For information about restrictions on table names, see <linkText>Understanding the Table service data model[table-data-model]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For information about restrictions on table names, see <linkText>Understanding the Table service data model[table-data-model]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To add an entity to a table, create a new Entity object and pass it to TableRestProxy->insertEntity.
trans-unit.target: To add an entity to a table, create a new Entity object and pass it to TableRestProxy->insertEntity.

trans-unit.source: Note that when you create an entity, you must specify a PartitionKey and RowKey.
trans-unit.target: Note that when you create an entity, you must specify a PartitionKey and RowKey.

trans-unit.source: These are the unique identifiers for an entity and are values that can be queried much faster than other entity properties.
trans-unit.target: These are the unique identifiers for an entity and are values that can be queried much faster than other entity properties.

trans-unit.source: The system uses PartitionKey to automatically distribute the table’s entities over many storage nodes.
trans-unit.target: The system uses PartitionKey to automatically distribute the table’s entities over many storage nodes.

trans-unit.source: Entities with the same PartitionKey are stored on the same node.
trans-unit.target: Entities with the same PartitionKey are stored on the same node.

trans-unit.source: (Operations on multiple entities stored on the same node perform better than on entities stored across different nodes.)
trans-unit.target: (Operations on multiple entities stored on the same node perform better than on entities stored across different nodes.)

trans-unit.source: The RowKey is the unique ID of an entity within a partition.
trans-unit.target: The RowKey is the unique ID of an entity within a partition.

trans-unit.source: For information about Table properties and types, see <linkText>Understanding the Table service data model[table-data-model]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For information about Table properties and types, see <linkText>Understanding the Table service data model[table-data-model]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The TableRestProxy class offers two alternative methods for inserting entities: insertOrMergeEntity and insertOrReplaceEntity.
trans-unit.target: The TableRestProxy class offers two alternative methods for inserting entities: insertOrMergeEntity and insertOrReplaceEntity.

trans-unit.source: To use these methods, create a new Entity and pass it as a parameter to either method.
trans-unit.target: To use these methods, create a new Entity and pass it as a parameter to either method.

trans-unit.source: Each method will insert the entity if it does not exist.
trans-unit.target: Each method will insert the entity if it does not exist.

trans-unit.source: If the entity already exists, insertOrMergeEntity updates property values if the properties already exist and adds new properties if they do not exist, while insertOrReplaceEntity completely replaces an existing entity.
trans-unit.target: If the entity already exists, insertOrMergeEntity updates property values if the properties already exist and adds new properties if they do not exist, while insertOrReplaceEntity completely replaces an existing entity.

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to use insertOrMergeEntity.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows how to use insertOrMergeEntity.

trans-unit.source: If the entity with PartitionKey "tasksSeattle" and RowKey "1" does not already exist, it will be inserted.
trans-unit.target: If the entity with PartitionKey "tasksSeattle" and RowKey "1" does not already exist, it will be inserted.

trans-unit.source: However, if it has previously been inserted (as shown in the example above), the DueDate property will be updated, and the Status property will be added.
trans-unit.target: However, if it has previously been inserted (as shown in the example above), the DueDate property will be updated, and the Status property will be added.

trans-unit.source: The Description and Location properties are also updated, but with values that effectively leave them unchanged.
trans-unit.target: The Description and Location properties are also updated, but with values that effectively leave them unchanged.

trans-unit.source: If these latter two properties were not added as shown in the example, but existed on the target entity, their existing values would remain unchanged.
trans-unit.target: If these latter two properties were not added as shown in the example, but existed on the target entity, their existing values would remain unchanged.

trans-unit.source: The TableRestProxy->getEntity method allows you to retrieve a single entity by querying for its PartitionKey and RowKey.
trans-unit.target: The TableRestProxy->getEntity method allows you to retrieve a single entity by querying for its PartitionKey and RowKey.

trans-unit.source: In the example below, the partition key tasksSeattle and row key 1 are passed to the getEntity method.
trans-unit.target: In the example below, the partition key tasksSeattle and row key 1 are passed to the getEntity method.

trans-unit.source: Entity queries are constructed using filters (for more information, see <linkText>Querying Tables and Entities[filters]</linkText><title></title>).
trans-unit.target: Entity queries are constructed using filters (for more information, see <linkText>Querying Tables and Entities[filters]</linkText><title></title>).

trans-unit.source: To retrieve all entities in partition, use the filter "PartitionKey eq partition_name".
trans-unit.target: To retrieve all entities in partition, use the filter "PartitionKey eq partition_name".

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to retrieve all entities in the tasksSeattle partition by passing a filter to the queryEntities method.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows how to retrieve all entities in the tasksSeattle partition by passing a filter to the queryEntities method.

trans-unit.source: The same pattern used in the previous example can be used to retrieve any subset of entities in a partition.
trans-unit.target: The same pattern used in the previous example can be used to retrieve any subset of entities in a partition.

trans-unit.source: The subset of entities you retrieve are determined by the filter you use (for more information, see Querying tables and entities[filters]).The following example shows how to use a filter to retrieve all entities with a specific Location and a DueDate less than a specified date.
trans-unit.target: The subset of entities you retrieve are determined by the filter you use (for more information, see Querying tables and entities[filters]).The following example shows how to use a filter to retrieve all entities with a specific Location and a DueDate less than a specified date.

trans-unit.source: A query can retrieve a subset of entity properties.
trans-unit.target: A query can retrieve a subset of entity properties.

trans-unit.source: This technique, called projection, reduces bandwidth and can improve query performance, especially for large entities.
trans-unit.target: This technique, called projection, reduces bandwidth and can improve query performance, especially for large entities.

trans-unit.source: To specify a property to be retrieved, pass the name of the property to the Query->addSelectField method.
trans-unit.target: To specify a property to be retrieved, pass the name of the property to the Query->addSelectField method.

trans-unit.source: You can call this method multiple times to add more properties.
trans-unit.target: You can call this method multiple times to add more properties.

trans-unit.source: After executing TableRestProxy->queryEntities, the returned entities will only have the selected properties.
trans-unit.target: After executing TableRestProxy->queryEntities, the returned entities will only have the selected properties.

trans-unit.source: (If you want to return a subset of Table entities, use a filter as shown in the queries above.)
trans-unit.target: (If you want to return a subset of Table entities, use a filter as shown in the queries above.)

trans-unit.source: An existing entity can be updated by using the Entity->setProperty and Entity->addProperty methods on the entity, and then calling TableRestProxy->updateEntity.
trans-unit.target: An existing entity can be updated by using the Entity->setProperty and Entity->addProperty methods on the entity, and then calling TableRestProxy->updateEntity.

trans-unit.source: The following example retrieves an entity, modifies one property, removes another property, and adds a new property.
trans-unit.target: The following example retrieves an entity, modifies one property, removes another property, and adds a new property.

trans-unit.source: Note that you can remove a property by setting its value to null.
trans-unit.target: Note that you can remove a property by setting its value to null.

trans-unit.source: To delete an entity, pass the table name, and the entity's PartitionKey and RowKey to the TableRestProxy->deleteEntity method.
trans-unit.target: To delete an entity, pass the table name, and the entity's PartitionKey and RowKey to the TableRestProxy->deleteEntity method.

trans-unit.source: Note that for concurrency checks, you can set the Etag for an entity to be deleted by using the DeleteEntityOptions->setEtag method and passing the DeleteEntityOptions object to deleteEntity as a fourth parameter.
trans-unit.target: Note that for concurrency checks, you can set the Etag for an entity to be deleted by using the DeleteEntityOptions->setEtag method and passing the DeleteEntityOptions object to deleteEntity as a fourth parameter.

trans-unit.source: The TableRestProxy->batch method allows you to execute multiple operations in a single request.
trans-unit.target: The TableRestProxy->batch method allows you to execute multiple operations in a single request.

trans-unit.source: The pattern here involves adding operations to BatchRequest object and then passing the BatchRequest object to the TableRestProxy->batch method.
trans-unit.target: The pattern here involves adding operations to BatchRequest object and then passing the BatchRequest object to the TableRestProxy->batch method.

trans-unit.source: To add an operation to a BatchRequest object, you can call any of the following methods multiple times:
trans-unit.target: To add an operation to a BatchRequest object, you can call any of the following methods multiple times:

trans-unit.source: addInsertEntity (adds an insertEntity operation)
trans-unit.target: addInsertEntity (adds an insertEntity operation)

trans-unit.source: addUpdateEntity (adds an updateEntity operation)
trans-unit.target: addUpdateEntity (adds an updateEntity operation)

trans-unit.source: addMergeEntity (adds a mergeEntity operation)
trans-unit.target: addMergeEntity (adds a mergeEntity operation)

trans-unit.source: addInsertOrReplaceEntity (adds an insertOrReplaceEntity operation)
trans-unit.target: addInsertOrReplaceEntity (adds an insertOrReplaceEntity operation)

trans-unit.source: addInsertOrMergeEntity (adds an insertOrMergeEntity operation)
trans-unit.target: addInsertOrMergeEntity (adds an insertOrMergeEntity operation)

trans-unit.source: addDeleteEntity (adds a deleteEntity operation)
trans-unit.target: addDeleteEntity (adds a deleteEntity operation)

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to execute insertEntity and deleteEntity operations in a single request:
trans-unit.target: The following example shows how to execute insertEntity and deleteEntity operations in a single request:

trans-unit.source: For more information about batching Table operations, see <linkText>Performing entity group transactions[entity-group-transactions]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about batching Table operations, see <linkText>Performing entity group transactions[entity-group-transactions]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Finally, to delete a table, pass the table name to the TableRestProxy->deleteTable method.
trans-unit.target: Finally, to delete a table, pass the table name to the TableRestProxy->deleteTable method.

trans-unit.source: Now that you’ve learned the basics of the Azure Table service, follow these links to learn about more complex storage tasks.
trans-unit.target: Now that you’ve learned the basics of the Azure Table service, follow these links to learn about more complex storage tasks.

trans-unit.target: See the MSDN Reference: <linkText>Azure Storage</linkText><title></title>
